metadata.title: Ready, set, relay: Protect app traffic with network relays

abstract.text: Learn how relays can make your app‚Äôs network traffic more private and secure without the overhead of a VPN. We‚Äôll show you how to integrate relay servers in your own app and explore how enterprise networks can use relays to securely access internal resources.

abstract.text: iCloud Private Relay is an iCloud+ service that prevents networks and servers from monitoring a person‚Äôs activity across the internet. Discover how your app can participate in this transition to a more secure and private internet: We‚Äôll show you how to prepare your apps, servers, and networks to work with iCloud Private Relay.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: Get ready for iCloud Private Relay

abstract.text: Xcode 15, Swift 5.9, iOS 17, macOS 14 (Sonoma), tvOS 17, visionOS 1, watchOS 10.
Session notes shared by the community for the community.

At Apple, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right. Learn about new technologies on Apple platforms that make it easier for you to implement essential privacy patterns that build customer trust in your app. Discover privacy improvements for Apple‚Äôs platforms, as well as a study of how privacy shaped the software architecture and design for the input model on visionOS.

doc://WWDCNotes/documentation/WWDCNotes/.title: What‚Äôs new in managing Apple devices

abstract.text: Learn about the latest management capabilities for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS. Discover how you can streamline the setup experience with enhancements to automated device enrollment and a new return-to-service option for iOS and iPadOS devices. We‚Äôll share how to use your identity provider in even more places on macOS and show you how Apple Configurator can help automate tasks.
